 1.) I had a good upbringing. My father was in my life before he passed away 3 years ago, even though my parents were divorced. My mother and I are very close, but I shared an equal closeness with both. Oh, and my dad died AFTER I came out, so I didn't just "become gay" b/c he died.
 
 2.) Sob story? You're pathetic. You don't know the struggles some of us go through in a homophobic society, of repressing our feelings b/c not everyone gets it, and it's worse when it's within family. But people like you suck even more.
 
 3.) Umm no, our marriages would actually LAST. We wouldn't really have anything to "complain" about after that.

Why are there so many people that express interest in who I love? (A rhetorical question)
 
 Why are there so many people that express interest in how I love? (Also a rhetorical question)
 
 With all of the atrocities in this country and the world, it seems so odd that politicians and those of "religion," as well as the public in general, are so interested in our personal lives.
 
 Why can't the politicians and those of "religion" and the public in general place their interest in the atrocities? 
 
 And to negate an expected reply, who I love and how I love is not an atrocity in any way.
